header.description: Three scalar values: reporting period start, end, and report generation timestamp. date_from and date_to come from user-supplied parameters; generated_at is injected at runtime as the current UTC timestamp.

rows.description: One row per (job_id, minute_utc) pair from app_metrics_jobs_minute, filtered to the requested reporting window. Each row carries read/write counts, error counts, and latency percentile values.

totals.description: No totals section defined in this template.

semantics: date_from and date_to are required user-supplied filter parameters that bound the minute_utc range returned. generated_at is a pass-through parameter injected by the report runner at generation time (not stored in the database).
transformations: No reshape required â€” all row data comes from a single flat table (app_metrics_jobs_minute).
Filter rows to minute_utc between date_from and date_to (inclusive).
Order results by job_id ascending, then minute_utc ascending.
Inject generated_at as a runtime scalar (current UTC timestamp) at report generation time.
